title: The Resurrection
shortSummary: John chapter 20 recounts the resurrection of Jesus Christ, beginning with Mary Magdalene's discovery of the empty tomb and culminating in Jesus' appearances to His disciples. This chapter affirms the reality of Christ’s victory over death, the fulfillment of Scripture, and the commissioning of His followers to spread the gospel.
timeline: c. AD 30-33 - The Resurrection of Jesus Christ

keyCharacters.name: Mary Magdalene
keyCharacters.description: A devoted follower of Jesus who discovers the empty tomb and is the first to see the risen Christ.

keyCharacters.name: Simon Peter
keyCharacters.description: One of Jesus’ closest disciples who investigates the empty tomb and later witnesses the risen Lord.

keyCharacters.name: The Beloved Disciple
keyCharacters.description: The disciple whom Jesus loved, who arrives at the tomb before Peter and believes upon seeing the linen cloths.

keyCharacters.name: Thomas
keyCharacters.description: One of the twelve disciples who initially doubts Jesus’ resurrection until he sees and touches Jesus’ wounds.

keyCharacters.name: Jesus Christ
keyCharacters.description: The risen Lord who appears to Mary Magdalene and His disciples, bringing peace and commissioning them.

definitions.definition: A tomb or burial place; in this chapter, it refers to the tomb where Jesus was laid after His crucifixion.
The cloth that was wrapped around Jesus’ head separately from the linen burial cloths, indicating intentional resurrection.
Refers to Jesus’ return to the Father in heaven after His resurrection, a key event in Christian doctrine.
The third Person of the Trinity, also called the Holy Spirit, given to believers to empower and guide them.

outline.heading: The Empty Tomb Discovered
outline.description: Mary Magdalene finds the tomb empty and informs Peter and the beloved disciple, who verify the absence of Jesus’ body and begin to understand the resurrection.

outline.heading: Mary Magdalene’s Encounter with Jesus
outline.description: Mary weeps outside the tomb, encounters angels, and then Jesus Himself, who reveals Himself to her and commissions her to tell the disciples.

outline.heading: Jesus Appears to the Disciples
outline.description: On the evening of the resurrection day, Jesus appears to His fearful disciples, offers peace, shows His wounds, and imparts the Holy Spirit with authority to forgive sins.

outline.heading: Thomas’ Doubt and Confession
outline.description: Thomas doubts the resurrection until Jesus appears again and invites him to touch His wounds, leading to Thomas’ profound declaration of faith.

outline.heading: Purpose of the Gospel
outline.description: The chapter concludes by stating the purpose of the recorded signs: to lead readers to believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and to receive eternal life through Him.

application: Trust in the resurrection of Jesus as the foundation of your faith and hope for eternal life.
Respond to Jesus’ peace in times of fear and uncertainty by seeking His presence through prayer and Scripture.
Embrace the Holy Spirit’s power to forgive sins and empower your witness for Christ.
Overcome doubt by seeking Jesus personally and confessing Him as Lord and God.

keyVerses.text: Jesus saith unto him, Thomas, because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the blessedness of faith without physical sight, encouraging believers to trust in Christ by faith.

keyVerses.text: But these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.
keyVerses.significance: This verse states the purpose of the Gospel of John: to lead people to faith in Jesus as Savior and to receive eternal life.

keyVerses.text: And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Ghost:
keyVerses.significance: Jesus imparts the Holy Spirit to His disciples, empowering them for ministry and the forgiveness of sins.
